meanings.definition: To strip or deprive (someone) of something
meanings.sent1: The thief was caught divesting the store of its valuables.
meanings.sent2: She divested her brother of his toy when he wouldn't share.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was divesting the bird feeder of all its seeds.
meanings.sent4: The storm was divesting the trees of their colorful leaves.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved divesting the volunteer of her watch without her noticing.

meanings.definition: To rid oneself of something, especially an investment or possession
meanings.sent1: He decided to divest himself of all unnecessary belongings before moving.
meanings.sent2: The company is divesting its shares in the failing business.
meanings.sent3: The cluttered attic was divested of old furniture and boxes.
meanings.sent4: She felt lighter after divesting herself of toxic relationships.
meanings.sent5: The decision to divest the property proved to be a wise financial move.
